name: polder
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an area of low land that was once under the sea but that has been separated from it by dykes (= walls or channels built to prevent water covering an area): In the Netherlands, millions of people live in drained polders below sea level. More than 2500 km of dykes have been constructed to protect the Dutch polders from flooding.
More examplesFewer examplesPowerful pumps keep the polders from flooding.A polder is a large area of land containing farms and villages encircled by dykes.The polder system could isolate the flooding to a smaller area.
